intro: Besseya reflexa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf false indigo, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showing adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Besseya reflexa is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
